text: At around 10:45 a.m. IST on 7 February 2021, a flooding disaster happened in the Chamoli district of Uttarakhand in northern India along the Alaknanda and Dhauliganga rivers. It is believed that a landslide, avalanche or a glacial lake outburst flood was the cause of the incident. More than 26 were killed and more than 200 are missing. ==References== Category:2021 floods in Asia Category:February 2021 events Category:Floods in India 2021 flood Category:2021 disasters in India
title: 2021 Uttarakhand glacial outburst flood
